description: Conversion of existing hotel into nine self-contained units, with associated bin storage, bicycle parking, and communal amenity space; external alterations involving hard and soft landscaping to front and rear of property (Amended description)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: Location Plan, Block Plan, 1097/01 (Existing Block and Ground Floor Plans), 1097/02 (Existing Floor Plans), 1097/03 (West Elevation as Existing), 1097/04 (Existing North Elevation), 1097/05 (Existing East Elevation), 1097/06 (Existing South Elevation), 1097/07A (Proposed Ground Floor & Site Plans), 1097/08A (Proposed First and Second Floor Plans), 1097/09A (Proposed South Elevation), 1097/10B (Proposed North Elevation), 1097/11A (Proposed East Elevation), 1097/12A (West Elevation as Proposed) and 1097/13 (Proposed Section AA).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| No part of the roof of the building shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012). | Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of the cycle storage facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the number and capacity of the stores, the location of the stores and the materials for the store. The approved storage areas shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason:  Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of the refuse and recycling storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the number and capacity of bins, the location of storage and the materials for the store. The approved storage shall be brought into use prior to the first use of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the developmen, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Council in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, namely, namely, multi-use studios and kitchen/living/dining/bathroom above/below/adjoining bedroom/sleeping accommodation of separate dwellings. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Ealing SPG10.

| Prior to commencement of the development details shall be submitted to and approved by the Council in writing, of the hard and soft landscaping works and boundary treatments. The details shall include:
a.	Species of planting and age at time of planting
b.	Materials/finishes for hard landscaping, the materials
c.	Height and appearance of boundary treatments
d.	Five (5) year maintenance plan for soft landscaping.
The approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure high quality amenity spaces for future occupiers and to ensure units benefit from adequate levels of privacy in accordance with policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
